Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for private IP address allocation, subnet configuration, and integration with existing on-premises and Azure networks.
Design the IP addressing scheme, including subnet sizes, address ranges, and reserved IPs for critical services.
Set up a virtual network in Azure to host the private IPs. Define subnets and configure address spaces.
Assign private IP addresses to Azure resources such as virtual machines, load balancers, and application gateways.
Apply security controls such as Network Security Groups (NSGs) and Azure Firewall to protect resources using private IPs.
Set up VPN or ExpressRoute connections to integrate the Azure private IP network with the on-premises network.
Perform connectivity tests to ensure private IPs are reachable within the virtual network and across hybrid connections.
Set up monitoring and alerting for private IP usage, network traffic, and resource health using Azure Monitor and Network Watcher.
Document the private IP setup, including IP ranges, subnet configurations, and security measures. Share documentation with relevant teams.
Ensure the private IP setup complies with organizational and regulatory standards. Conduct regular audits to verify compliance.
